page.title: 15Churches
page.content: {Saint John the Baptist. {Penshurst Church}is 865 years old. There are many hassocks in the church. Some of them are embroidered with the initials AEL. There are 8 bells in the tower rung from the ground floor every Sunday. The Becket window designed and made by Lawrence Lee in 1970, commerates the Martyrdom of St.Thomas who was Patron of Penshurst in 1170. {Saint Mary the Virgin.} {Speldhurst Church}is about 700 years old. It has a peel of 8 bells. In the chapel there is a beautiful alter cloth all seasons. It is called the Marter Cloth. It has green for peace, red for the blood shed, purple for mourning and blue for Pentecost the coming of the Holy Spirit.
